thread.title: Renowned violinist comes to Englewood - Music
thread.title_full: Renowned violinist comes to Englewood - Music - NorthJersey.com

author: The Record
title: Renowned violinist comes to Englewood - Music
text:
7 P.M. SUNDAY, ENGLEWOOD
Buy this photo — Kara Yorio CLASSIC PERLMAN
He has played for U.S. presidents and the queen of England, has a Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award, is a Kennedy Center honoree and is arguably the most well-known classical musician in the world. Violinist Itzhak Perlman returns to North Jersey as part of bergenPAC's Wilmington Trust Cultural Arts Series.
TELL ME MORE: The 70-year-old Israeli native has played with every major orchestra around the world and conducted more than a few, including the New York Philharmonic, Chicago Symphony, Philadelphia Orchestra and National Symphony. He seems to be constantly on the road and not just performing concerts. He is well-known for his television appearances that go beyond PBS to the late night talk show circuit. This concert is expected to feature concertos by Ludwig van Beethoven, Max Bruch and Felix Mendelssohn. In addition, the Elisabeth Morrow School Orchestra will perform a prelude concert.
DETAILS: 7 p.m. Sunday, Bergen Performing Arts Center, 30 N. Van Brunt St., Englewood, bergenpac.org, 201-227-1030. Tickets are $49 to $129; ticketmaster.com, 800-745-3000.
FOR MORE INFO: itzhakperlman.com.
— Kara Yorio
